issue.title: front panel settings not loaded correctly if blacs is not run as a module

content.raw:
Ok so here is what is happening (but I don't know why): The typecheck in connectiontable.compare_to() fails with explicit imports. I added a print statement to the top of the compare_to() function:

```
#!python

print( type(other_table) , isinstance(other_table,ConnectionTable))
```

with explicit imports this prints  
(<class 'blacs.connections.ConnectionTable'>, False)

If I remove the explicit import from front panel settings everything works fine and prints 
 (<class 'connections.ConnectionTable'>, True)

If instead I add a explicit import to connections as well (which my original pull request did not do) everything works fine as well and prints
(<class 'blacs.connections.ConnectionTable'>, True)

So I guess we need to add a explicit import to the connection table import or merge the pull request moving connections.py to labscript_utils when adding the explicit imports again.
content.html:
Ok so here is what is happening (but I don't know why): The typecheck in connectiontable.compare_to() fails with explicit imports. I added a print statement to the top of the compare_to() function:

print( type(other_table) , isinstance(other_table,ConnectionTable))

with explicit imports this prints
(<class 'blacs.connections.ConnectionTable'>, False)

If I remove the explicit import from front panel settings everything works fine and prints (<class 'connections.ConnectionTable'>, True)

If instead I add a explicit import to connections as well (which my original pull request did not do) everything works fine as well and prints (<class 'blacs.connections.ConnectionTable'>, True)

So I guess we need to add a explicit import to the connection table import or merge the pull request moving connections.py to labscript_utils when adding the explicit imports again.
